ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:0.5_0: The training rule on receiving an even measure of bean curry
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood with large amounts of bean curry. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.3.1_0: “‘I will receive almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.5_0: there are two kinds of bean curry, to be taken with the hand: mung-bean curry and black-gram curry.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.6_0: he should receive the almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.7_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives much bean curry, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.15_0: if he asks those who have given an invitation;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.16_0: if he asks for the benefit of someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.17_0: if it is by means of one’s own property;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.18_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.21_0: The ninth rule, the training rule on nine, is finished.
